abstract: Private equity firms demand strict confidentiality from investors regarding fund documents, contending that they would reveal trade secrets if disclosed. Investors in private equity deals agree to these requests by heavily redacting broad sections of fund documents. An example of how extensive these redactions can be is apparent in this Carlyle Partners V limited partnership agreement.

headline.main: Redacted Carlyle Partners Limited Partnership Agreement
